5168  /**
5169   * Verifies that the .regioninfo file is written on region creation and that is recreated if
5170   * missing during region opening.
5171   */
5172  @Test
5173  public void testRegionInfoFileCreation() throws IOException {
5174    Path rootDir = new Path(dir + "testRegionInfoFileCreation");
5175
5176    TableDescriptorBuilder tableDescriptorBuilder =
5177      TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(TableName.valueOf(name.getMethodName()));
5178    ColumnFamilyDescriptor columnFamilyDescriptor =
5179      ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(Bytes.toBytes("cf")).build();
5180    tableDescriptorBuilder.setColumnFamily(columnFamilyDescriptor);
5181    TableDescriptor tableDescriptor = tableDescriptorBuilder.build();
5182
5183    RegionInfo hri = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(tableDescriptor.getTableName()).build();
5184
5185    // Create a region and skip the initialization (like CreateTableHandler)
5186    region = HBaseTestingUtil.createRegionAndWAL(hri, rootDir, CONF, tableDescriptor, false);
5187    Path regionDir = region.getRegionFileSystem().getRegionDir();
5188    FileSystem fs = region.getRegionFileSystem().getFileSystem();
5189    HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(region);
5190
5191    Path regionInfoFile = new Path(regionDir, HRegionFileSystem.REGION_INFO_FILE);
5192
5193    // Verify that the .regioninfo file is present
5194    assertTrue(HRegionFileSystem.REGION_INFO_FILE + " should be present in the region dir",
5195      fs.exists(regionInfoFile));
5196
5197    // Try to open the region
5198    region = HRegion.openHRegion(rootDir, hri, tableDescriptor, null, CONF);
5199    assertEquals(regionDir, region.getRegionFileSystem().getRegionDir());
5200    HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(region);
5201
5202    // Verify that the .regioninfo file is still there
5203    assertTrue(HRegionFileSystem.REGION_INFO_FILE + " should be present in the region dir",
5204      fs.exists(regionInfoFile));
5205
5206    // Remove the .regioninfo file and verify is recreated on region open
5207    fs.delete(regionInfoFile, true);
5208    assertFalse(HRegionFileSystem.REGION_INFO_FILE + " should be removed from the region dir",
5209      fs.exists(regionInfoFile));
5210
5211    region = HRegion.openHRegion(rootDir, hri, tableDescriptor, null, CONF);
5212    // region = TEST_UTIL.openHRegion(hri, htd);
5213    assertEquals(regionDir, region.getRegionFileSystem().getRegionDir());
5214    HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(region);
5215
5216    // Verify that the .regioninfo file is still there
5217    assertTrue(HRegionFileSystem.REGION_INFO_FILE + " should be present in the region dir",
5218      fs.exists(new Path(regionDir, HRegionFileSystem.REGION_INFO_FILE)));
5219
5220    region = null;
5221  }

5223  /**
5224   * TestCase for increment
5225   */
5226  private static class Incrementer implements Runnable {
5227    private HRegion region;
5228    private final static byte[] incRow = Bytes.toBytes("incRow");
5229    private final static byte[] family = Bytes.toBytes("family");
5230    private final static byte[] qualifier = Bytes.toBytes("qualifier");
5231    private final static long ONE = 1L;
5232    private int incCounter;
5233
5234    public Incrementer(HRegion region, int incCounter) {
5235      this.region = region;
5236      this.incCounter = incCounter;
5237    }
5238
5239    @Override
5240    public void run() {
5241      int count = 0;
5242      while (count < incCounter) {
5243        Increment inc = new Increment(incRow);
5244        inc.addColumn(family, qualifier, ONE);
5245        count++;
5246        try {
5247          region.increment(inc);
5248        } catch (IOException e) {
5249          LOG.info("Count=" + count + ", " + e);
5250          break;
5251        }
5252      }
5253    }
5254  }

5256  /**
5257   * Test case to check increment function with memstore flushing
5258   */
5259  @Test
5260  public void testParallelIncrementWithMemStoreFlush() throws Exception {
5261    byte[] family = Incrementer.family;
5262    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, family);
5263    final HRegion region = this.region;
5264    final AtomicBoolean incrementDone = new AtomicBoolean(false);
5265    Runnable flusher = new Runnable() {
5266      @Override
5267      public void run() {
5268        while (!incrementDone.get()) {
5269          try {
5270            region.flush(true);
5271          } catch (Exception e) {
5272            e.printStackTrace();
5273          }
5274        }
5275      }
5276    };
5277
5278    // after all increment finished, the row will increment to 20*100 = 2000
5279    int threadNum = 20;
5280    int incCounter = 100;
5281    long expected = (long) threadNum * incCounter;
5282    Thread[] incrementers = new Thread[threadNum];
5283    Thread flushThread = new Thread(flusher);
5284    for (int i = 0; i < threadNum; i++) {
5285      incrementers[i] = new Thread(new Incrementer(this.region, incCounter));
5286      incrementers[i].start();
5287    }
5288    flushThread.start();
5289    for (int i = 0; i < threadNum; i++) {
5290      incrementers[i].join();
5291    }
5292
5293    incrementDone.set(true);
5294    flushThread.join();
5295
5296    Get get = new Get(Incrementer.incRow);
5297    get.addColumn(Incrementer.family, Incrementer.qualifier);
5298    get.readVersions(1);
5299    Result res = this.region.get(get);
5300    List<Cell> kvs = res.getColumnCells(Incrementer.family, Incrementer.qualifier);
5301
5302    // we just got the latest version
5303    assertEquals(1, kvs.size());
5304    Cell kv = kvs.get(0);
5305    assertEquals(expected, Bytes.toLong(kv.getValueArray(), kv.getValueOffset()));
5306  }

5341  /**
5342   * Test case to check append function with memstore flushing
5343   */
5344  @Test
5345  public void testParallelAppendWithMemStoreFlush() throws Exception {
5346    byte[] family = Appender.family;
5347    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, family);
5348    final HRegion region = this.region;
5349    final AtomicBoolean appendDone = new AtomicBoolean(false);
5350    Runnable flusher = new Runnable() {
5351      @Override
5352      public void run() {
5353        while (!appendDone.get()) {
5354          try {
5355            region.flush(true);
5356          } catch (Exception e) {
5357            e.printStackTrace();
5358          }
5359        }
5360      }
5361    };
5362
5363    // After all append finished, the value will append to threadNum *
5364    // appendCounter Appender.CHAR
5365    int threadNum = 20;
5366    int appendCounter = 100;
5367    byte[] expected = new byte[threadNum * appendCounter];
5368    for (int i = 0; i < threadNum * appendCounter; i++) {
5369      System.arraycopy(Appender.CHAR, 0, expected, i, 1);
5370    }
5371    Thread[] appenders = new Thread[threadNum];
5372    Thread flushThread = new Thread(flusher);
5373    for (int i = 0; i < threadNum; i++) {
5374      appenders[i] = new Thread(new Appender(this.region, appendCounter));
5375      appenders[i].start();
5376    }
5377    flushThread.start();
5378    for (int i = 0; i < threadNum; i++) {
5379      appenders[i].join();
5380    }
5381
5382    appendDone.set(true);
5383    flushThread.join();
5384
5385    Get get = new Get(Appender.appendRow);
5386    get.addColumn(Appender.family, Appender.qualifier);
5387    get.readVersions(1);
5388    Result res = this.region.get(get);
5389    List<Cell> kvs = res.getColumnCells(Appender.family, Appender.qualifier);
5390
5391    // we just got the latest version
5392    assertEquals(1, kvs.size());
5393    Cell kv = kvs.get(0);
5394    byte[] appendResult = new byte[kv.getValueLength()];
5395    System.arraycopy(kv.getValueArray(), kv.getValueOffset(), appendResult, 0, kv.getValueLength());
5396    assertArrayEquals(expected, appendResult);
5397  }

5457  /**
5458   * For this test,the spied {@link AsyncFSWAL} can not work properly because of a Mockito defect
5459   * that can not deal with classes which have a field of an inner class. See discussions in
5460   * HBASE-15536.When we reuse the code of {@link AsyncFSWAL} for {@link FSHLog}, this test could
5461   * not work for {@link FSHLog} also.
5462   */
5463  @Test
5464  @Ignore
5465  public void testDurability() throws Exception {
5466    // there are 5 x 5 cases:
5467    // table durability(SYNC,FSYNC,ASYC,SKIP,USE_DEFAULT) x mutation
5468    // durability(SYNC,FSYNC,ASYC,SKIP,USE_DEFAULT)
5469
5470    // expected cases for append and sync wal
5471    durabilityTest(method, Durability.SYNC_WAL, Durability.SYNC_WAL, 0, true, true, false);
5472    durabilityTest(method, Durability.SYNC_WAL, Durability.FSYNC_WAL, 0, true, true, false);
5473    durabilityTest(method, Durability.SYNC_WAL, Durability.USE_DEFAULT, 0, true, true, false);
5474
5475    durabilityTest(method, Durability.FSYNC_WAL, Durability.SYNC_WAL, 0, true, true, false);

5513
5514  private void durabilityTest(String method, Durability tableDurability,
5515    Durability mutationDurability, long timeout, boolean expectAppend, final boolean expectSync,
5516    final boolean expectSyncFromLogSyncer) throws Exception {
5517    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create(CONF);
5518    conf.setLong(AbstractFSWAL.WAL_SHUTDOWN_WAIT_TIMEOUT_MS, 60 * 60 * 1000);
5519    method = method + "_" + tableDurability.name() + "_" + mutationDurability.name();
5520    byte[] family = Bytes.toBytes("family");
5521    Path logDir = new Path(new Path(dir + method), "log");
5522    final Configuration walConf = new Configuration(conf);
5523    CommonFSUtils.setRootDir(walConf, logDir);
5524    // XXX: The spied AsyncFSWAL can not work properly because of a Mockito defect that can not
5525    // deal with classes which have a field of an inner class. See discussions in HBASE-15536.
5526    walConf.set(WALFactory.WAL_PROVIDER, "filesystem");
5527    final WALFactory wals = new WALFactory(walConf, HBaseTestingUtil.getRandomUUID().toString());
5528    final WAL wal = spy(wals.getWAL(RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(tableName).build()));
5529    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, HConstants.EMPTY_START_ROW, HConstants.EMPTY_END_ROW, CONF,
5530      false, tableDurability, wal, new byte[][] { family });
5531
5532    Put put = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("r1"));
5533    put.addColumn(family, Bytes.toBytes("q1"), Bytes.toBytes("v1"));
5534    put.setDurability(mutationDurability);
5535    region.put(put);
5536
5537    // verify append called or not
5538    verify(wal, expectAppend ? times(1) : never()).appendData((RegionInfo) any(),
5539      (WALKeyImpl) any(), (WALEdit) any());
5540
5541    // verify sync called or not
5542    if (expectSync || expectSyncFromLogSyncer) {
5543      TEST_UTIL.waitFor(timeout, new Waiter.Predicate<Exception>() {
5544        @Override
5545        public boolean evaluate() throws Exception {
5546          try {
5547            if (expectSync) {
5548              verify(wal, times(1)).sync(anyLong()); // Hregion calls this one
5549            } else if (expectSyncFromLogSyncer) {
5550              verify(wal, times(1)).sync(); // wal syncer calls this one
5551            }
5552          } catch (Throwable ignore) {
5553          }
5554          return true;
5555        }
5556      });
5557    } else {
5558      // verify(wal, never()).sync(anyLong());
5559      verify(wal, never()).sync();
5560    }
5561
5562    HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(this.region);
5563    wals.close();
5564    this.region = null;
5565  }

5567  @Test
5568  public void testRegionReplicaSecondary() throws IOException {
5569    // create a primary region, load some data and flush
5570    // create a secondary region, and do a get against that
5571    Path rootDir = new Path(dir + name.getMethodName());
5572    CommonFSUtils.setRootDir(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), rootDir);
5573
5574    byte[][] families =
5575      new byte[][] { Bytes.toBytes("cf1"), Bytes.toBytes("cf2"), Bytes.toBytes("cf3") };
5576    byte[] cq = Bytes.toBytes("cq");
5577    TableDescriptorBuilder builder =
5578      TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(TableName.valueOf(name.getMethodName()));
5579    for (byte[] family : families) {
5580      builder.setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.of(family));
5581    }
5582    TableDescriptor tableDescriptor = builder.build();
5583    long time = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
5584    RegionInfo primaryHri = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(tableDescriptor.getTableName())
5585      .setRegionId(time).setReplicaId(0).build();
5586    RegionInfo secondaryHri = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(tableDescriptor.getTableName())
5587      .setRegionId(time).setReplicaId(1).build();
5588
5589    HRegion primaryRegion = null, secondaryRegion = null;
5590
5591    try {
5592      primaryRegion = HBaseTestingUtil.createRegionAndWAL(primaryHri, rootDir,
5593        TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), tableDescriptor);
5594
5595      // load some data
5596      putData(primaryRegion, 0, 1000, cq, families);
5597
5598      // flush region
5599      primaryRegion.flush(true);
5600
5601      // open secondary region
5602      secondaryRegion = HRegion.openHRegion(rootDir, secondaryHri, tableDescriptor, null, CONF);
5603
5604      verifyData(secondaryRegion, 0, 1000, cq, families);
5605    } finally {
5606      if (primaryRegion != null) {
5607        HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(primaryRegion);
5608      }
5609      if (secondaryRegion != null) {
5610        HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(secondaryRegion);
5611      }
5612    }
5613  }

5674  @Test
5675  public void testCompactionFromPrimary() throws IOException {
5676    Path rootDir = new Path(dir + name.getMethodName());
5677    CommonFSUtils.setRootDir(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), rootDir);
5678
5679    byte[][] families =
5680      new byte[][] { Bytes.toBytes("cf1"), Bytes.toBytes("cf2"), Bytes.toBytes("cf3") };
5681    byte[] cq = Bytes.toBytes("cq");
5682    TableDescriptorBuilder builder =
5683      TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(TableName.valueOf(name.getMethodName()));
5684    for (byte[] family : families) {
5685      builder.setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.of(family));
5686    }
5687    TableDescriptor tableDescriptor = builder.build();
5688    long time = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
5689    RegionInfo primaryHri = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(tableDescriptor.getTableName())
5690      .setRegionId(time).setReplicaId(0).build();
5691    RegionInfo secondaryHri = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(tableDescriptor.getTableName())
5692      .setRegionId(time).setReplicaId(1).build();
5693
5694    HRegion primaryRegion = null, secondaryRegion = null;
5695
5696    try {
5697      primaryRegion = HBaseTestingUtil.createRegionAndWAL(primaryHri, rootDir,
5698        TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), tableDescriptor);
5699
5700      // load some data
5701      putData(primaryRegion, 0, 1000, cq, families);
5702
5703      // flush region
5704      primaryRegion.flush(true);
5705
5706      // open secondary region
5707      secondaryRegion = HRegion.openHRegion(rootDir, secondaryHri, tableDescriptor, null, CONF);
5708
5709      // move the file of the primary region to the archive, simulating a compaction
5710      Collection<HStoreFile> storeFiles = primaryRegion.getStore(families[0]).getStorefiles();
5711      primaryRegion.getRegionFileSystem().removeStoreFiles(Bytes.toString(families[0]), storeFiles);
5712      Collection<StoreFileInfo> storeFileInfos =
5713        primaryRegion.getRegionFileSystem().getStoreFiles(Bytes.toString(families[0]));
5714      Assert.assertTrue(storeFileInfos == null || storeFileInfos.isEmpty());
5715
5716      verifyData(secondaryRegion, 0, 1000, cq, families);
5717    } finally {
5718      if (primaryRegion != null) {
5719        HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(primaryRegion);
5720      }
5721      if (secondaryRegion != null) {
5722        HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(secondaryRegion);
5723      }
5724    }
5725  }
5726
5727  private void putData(int startRow, int numRows, byte[] qf, byte[]... families)
5728    throws IOException {
5729    putData(this.region, startRow, numRows, qf, families);
5730  }
5731
5732  private void putData(HRegion region, int startRow, int numRows, byte[] qf, byte[]... families)
5733    throws IOException {
5734    putData(region, Durability.SKIP_WAL, startRow, numRows, qf, families);
5735  }
5736
5737  static void putData(HRegion region, Durability durability, int startRow, int numRows, byte[] qf,
5738    byte[]... families) throws IOException {
5739    for (int i = startRow; i < startRow + numRows; i++) {
5740      Put put = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("" + i));
5741      put.setDurability(durability);
5742      for (byte[] family : families) {
5743        put.addColumn(family, qf, null);
5744      }
5745      region.put(put);
5746      LOG.info(put.toString());
5747    }
5748  }
5749
5750  static void verifyData(HRegion newReg, int startRow, int numRows, byte[] qf, byte[]... families)
5751    throws IOException {
5752    for (int i = startRow; i < startRow + numRows; i++) {
5753      byte[] row = Bytes.toBytes("" + i);
5754      Get get = new Get(row);
5755      for (byte[] family : families) {
5756        get.addColumn(family, qf);
5757      }
5758      Result result = newReg.get(get);
5759      Cell[] raw = result.rawCells();
5760      assertEquals(families.length, result.size());
5761      for (int j = 0; j < families.length; j++) {
5762        assertTrue(CellUtil.matchingRows(raw[j], row));
5763        assertTrue(CellUtil.matchingFamily(raw[j], families[j]));
5764        assertTrue(CellUtil.matchingQualifier(raw[j], qf));
5765      }
5766    }
5767  }
5768
5769  static void assertGet(final HRegion r, final byte[] family, final byte[] k) throws IOException {
5770    // Now I have k, get values out and assert they are as expected.
5771    Get get = new Get(k).addFamily(family).readAllVersions();
5772    Cell[] results = r.get(get).rawCells();
5773    for (int j = 0; j < results.length; j++) {
5774      byte[] tmp = CellUtil.cloneValue(results[j]);
5775      // Row should be equal to value every time.
5776      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(k, tmp));
5777    }
5778  }
5779
5780  /*
5781   * Assert first value in the passed region is <code>firstValue</code>.
5782   */
5783  protected void assertScan(final HRegion r, final byte[] fs, final byte[] firstValue)
5784    throws IOException {
5785    byte[][] families = { fs };
5786    Scan scan = new Scan();
5787    for (int i = 0; i < families.length; i++)
5788      scan.addFamily(families[i]);
5789    try (InternalScanner s = r.getScanner(scan)) {
5790      List<Cell> curVals = new ArrayList<>();
5791      boolean first = true;
5792      OUTER_LOOP: while (s.next(curVals)) {
5793        for (Cell kv : curVals) {
5794          byte[] val = CellUtil.cloneValue(kv);
5795          byte[] curval = val;
5796          if (first) {
5797            first = false;
5798            assertTrue(Bytes.compareTo(curval, firstValue) == 0);
5799          } else {
5800            // Not asserting anything. Might as well break.
5801            break OUTER_LOOP;
5802          }
5803        }
5804      }
5805    }
5806  }
5807
5808  /**
5809   * Test that we get the expected flush results back
5810   */
5811  @Test
5812  public void testFlushResult() throws IOException {
5813    byte[] family = Bytes.toBytes("family");
5814
5815    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, family);
5816
5817    // empty memstore, flush doesn't run
5818    HRegion.FlushResult fr = region.flush(true);
5819    assertFalse(fr.isFlushSucceeded());
5820    assertFalse(fr.isCompactionNeeded());
5821
5822    // Flush enough files to get up to the threshold, doesn't need compactions
5823    for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
5824      Put put = new Put(tableName.toBytes()).addColumn(family, family, tableName.toBytes());
5825      region.put(put);
5826      fr = region.flush(true);
5827      assertTrue(fr.isFlushSucceeded());
5828      assertFalse(fr.isCompactionNeeded());
5829    }
5830
5831    // Two flushes after the threshold, compactions are needed
5832    for (int i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
5833      Put put = new Put(tableName.toBytes()).addColumn(family, family, tableName.toBytes());
5834      region.put(put);
5835      fr = region.flush(true);
5836      assertTrue(fr.isFlushSucceeded());
5837      assertTrue(fr.isCompactionNeeded());
5838    }
5839  }
5840
5841  protected Configuration initSplit() {
5842    // Always compact if there is more than one store file.
5843    CONF.setInt("hbase.hstore.compactionThreshold", 2);
5844
5845    CONF.setInt(HConstants.HBASE_CLIENT_SCANNER_TIMEOUT_PERIOD, 10 * 1000);
5846
5847    // Increase the amount of time between client retries
5848    CONF.setLong("hbase.client.pause", 15 * 1000);
5849
5850    // This size should make it so we always split using the addContent
5851    // below. After adding all data, the first region is 1.3M
5852    CONF.setLong(HConstants.HREGION_MAX_FILESIZE, 1024 * 128);
5853    return CONF;
5854  }

5874  private HRegion initHRegion(TableName tableName, byte[] startKey, byte[] stopKey,
5875    String callingMethod, Configuration conf, boolean isReadOnly, byte[]... families)
5876    throws IOException {
5877    Path logDir = TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDirOnTestFS(callingMethod + ".log");
5878    RegionInfo hri =
5879      RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(tableName).setStartKey(startKey).setEndKey(stopKey).build();
5880    final WAL wal = HBaseTestingUtil.createWal(conf, logDir, hri);
5881    return initHRegion(tableName, startKey, stopKey, conf, isReadOnly, Durability.SYNC_WAL, wal,
5882      families);
5883  }

5889  protected HRegion initHRegion(TableName tableName, byte[] startKey, byte[] stopKey,
5890    Configuration conf, boolean isReadOnly, Durability durability, WAL wal, byte[]... families)
5891    throws IOException {

5893      MemStoreLAB.INDEX_CHUNK_SIZE_PERCENTAGE_DEFAULT);
5894    return TEST_UTIL.createLocalHRegion(tableName, startKey, stopKey, conf, isReadOnly, durability,
5895      wal, families);

5898  /**
5899   * Assert that the passed in Cell has expected contents for the specified row, column & timestamp.
5900   */
5901  private void checkOneCell(Cell kv, byte[] cf, int rowIdx, int colIdx, long ts) {
5902    String ctx = "rowIdx=" + rowIdx + "; colIdx=" + colIdx + "; ts=" + ts;
5903    assertEquals("Row mismatch which checking: " + ctx, "row:" + rowIdx,
5904      Bytes.toString(CellUtil.cloneRow(kv)));
5905    assertEquals("ColumnFamily mismatch while checking: " + ctx, Bytes.toString(cf),
5906      Bytes.toString(CellUtil.cloneFamily(kv)));
5907    assertEquals("Column qualifier mismatch while checking: " + ctx, "column:" + colIdx,
5908      Bytes.toString(CellUtil.cloneQualifier(kv)));
5909    assertEquals("Timestamp mismatch while checking: " + ctx, ts, kv.getTimestamp());
5910    assertEquals("Value mismatch while checking: " + ctx, "value-version-" + ts,
5911      Bytes.toString(CellUtil.cloneValue(kv)));
5912  }

5914  @Test
5915  public void testReverseScanner_FromMemStore_SingleCF_Normal() throws IOException {
5916    byte[] rowC = Bytes.toBytes("rowC");
5917    byte[] rowA = Bytes.toBytes("rowA");
5918    byte[] rowB = Bytes.toBytes("rowB");
5919    byte[] cf = Bytes.toBytes("CF");
5920    byte[][] families = { cf };
5921    byte[] col = Bytes.toBytes("C");
5922    long ts = 1;
5923    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, families);
5924    KeyValue kv1 = new KeyValue(rowC, cf, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
5925    KeyValue kv11 = new KeyValue(rowC, cf, col, ts + 1, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
5926    KeyValue kv2 = new KeyValue(rowA, cf, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
5927    KeyValue kv3 = new KeyValue(rowB, cf, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
5928    Put put = null;
5929    put = new Put(rowC);
5930    put.add(kv1);
5931    put.add(kv11);
5932    region.put(put);
5933    put = new Put(rowA);
5934    put.add(kv2);
5935    region.put(put);
5936    put = new Put(rowB);
5937    put.add(kv3);
5938    region.put(put);
5939
5940    Scan scan = new Scan().withStartRow(rowC);
5941    scan.readVersions(5);
5942    scan.setReversed(true);
5943    try (InternalScanner scanner = region.getScanner(scan)) {
5944      List<Cell> currRow = new ArrayList<>();
5945      boolean hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
5946      assertEquals(2, currRow.size());
5947      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
5948        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), rowC, 0, rowC.length));
5949      assertTrue(hasNext);
5950      currRow.clear();
5951      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
5952      assertEquals(1, currRow.size());
5953      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
5954        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), rowB, 0, rowB.length));
5955      assertTrue(hasNext);
5956      currRow.clear();
5957      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
5958      assertEquals(1, currRow.size());
5959      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
5960        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), rowA, 0, rowA.length));
5961      assertFalse(hasNext);
5962    }
5963  }

5965  @Test
5966  public void testReverseScanner_FromMemStore_SingleCF_LargerKey() throws IOException {
5967    byte[] rowC = Bytes.toBytes("rowC");
5968    byte[] rowA = Bytes.toBytes("rowA");
5969    byte[] rowB = Bytes.toBytes("rowB");
5970    byte[] rowD = Bytes.toBytes("rowD");
5971    byte[] cf = Bytes.toBytes("CF");
5972    byte[][] families = { cf };
5973    byte[] col = Bytes.toBytes("C");
5974    long ts = 1;
5975    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, families);
5976    KeyValue kv1 = new KeyValue(rowC, cf, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
5977    KeyValue kv11 = new KeyValue(rowC, cf, col, ts + 1, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
5978    KeyValue kv2 = new KeyValue(rowA, cf, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
5979    KeyValue kv3 = new KeyValue(rowB, cf, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
5980    Put put = null;
5981    put = new Put(rowC);
5982    put.add(kv1);
5983    put.add(kv11);
5984    region.put(put);
5985    put = new Put(rowA);
5986    put.add(kv2);
5987    region.put(put);
5988    put = new Put(rowB);
5989    put.add(kv3);
5990    region.put(put);
5991
5992    Scan scan = new Scan().withStartRow(rowD);
5993    List<Cell> currRow = new ArrayList<>();
5994    scan.setReversed(true);
5995    scan.readVersions(5);
5996    try (InternalScanner scanner = region.getScanner(scan)) {
5997      boolean hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
5998      assertEquals(2, currRow.size());
5999      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6000        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), rowC, 0, rowC.length));
6001      assertTrue(hasNext);
6002      currRow.clear();
6003      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6004      assertEquals(1, currRow.size());
6005      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6006        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), rowB, 0, rowB.length));
6007      assertTrue(hasNext);
6008      currRow.clear();
6009      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6010      assertEquals(1, currRow.size());
6011      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6012        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), rowA, 0, rowA.length));
6013      assertFalse(hasNext);
6014    }

6116      currRow.clear();
6117      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6118      assertEquals(1, currRow.size());
6119      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6120        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), rowC, 0, rowC.length));
6121      assertTrue(hasNext);
6122      currRow.clear();

6222  @Test
6223  public void testReverseScanner_FromMemStoreAndHFiles_MultiCFs1() throws IOException {
6224    byte[] row0 = Bytes.toBytes("row0"); // 1 kv
6225    byte[] row1 = Bytes.toBytes("row1"); // 2 kv
6226    byte[] row2 = Bytes.toBytes("row2"); // 4 kv
6227    byte[] row3 = Bytes.toBytes("row3"); // 2 kv
6228    byte[] row4 = Bytes.toBytes("row4"); // 5 kv
6229    byte[] row5 = Bytes.toBytes("row5"); // 2 kv
6230    byte[] cf1 = Bytes.toBytes("CF1");
6231    byte[] cf2 = Bytes.toBytes("CF2");
6232    byte[] cf3 = Bytes.toBytes("CF3");
6233    byte[][] families = { cf1, cf2, cf3 };
6234    byte[] col = Bytes.toBytes("C");
6235    long ts = 1;
6236    Configuration conf = new Configuration(CONF);
6237    // disable compactions in this test.
6238    conf.setInt("hbase.hstore.compactionThreshold", 10000);
6239    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, conf, families);
6240    // kv naming style: kv(row number) totalKvCountInThisRow seq no
6241    KeyValue kv0_1_1 = new KeyValue(row0, cf1, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6242    KeyValue kv1_2_1 = new KeyValue(row1, cf2, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6243    KeyValue kv1_2_2 = new KeyValue(row1, cf1, col, ts + 1, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6244    KeyValue kv2_4_1 = new KeyValue(row2, cf2, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6245    KeyValue kv2_4_2 = new KeyValue(row2, cf1, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6246    KeyValue kv2_4_3 = new KeyValue(row2, cf3, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6247    KeyValue kv2_4_4 = new KeyValue(row2, cf1, col, ts + 4, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6248    KeyValue kv3_2_1 = new KeyValue(row3, cf2, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6249    KeyValue kv3_2_2 = new KeyValue(row3, cf1, col, ts + 4, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6250    KeyValue kv4_5_1 = new KeyValue(row4, cf1, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6251    KeyValue kv4_5_2 = new KeyValue(row4, cf3, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6252    KeyValue kv4_5_3 = new KeyValue(row4, cf3, col, ts + 5, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6253    KeyValue kv4_5_4 = new KeyValue(row4, cf2, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6254    KeyValue kv4_5_5 = new KeyValue(row4, cf1, col, ts + 3, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6255    KeyValue kv5_2_1 = new KeyValue(row5, cf2, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6256    KeyValue kv5_2_2 = new KeyValue(row5, cf3, col, ts, KeyValue.Type.Put, null);
6257    // hfiles(cf1/cf2) :"row1"(1 kv) / "row2"(1 kv) / "row4"(2 kv)
6258    Put put = null;
6259    put = new Put(row1);
6260    put.add(kv1_2_1);
6261    region.put(put);
6262    put = new Put(row2);
6263    put.add(kv2_4_1);
6264    region.put(put);
6265    put = new Put(row4);
6266    put.add(kv4_5_4);
6267    put.add(kv4_5_5);
6268    region.put(put);
6269    region.flush(true);
6270    // hfiles(cf1/cf3) : "row1" (1 kvs) / "row2" (1 kv) / "row4" (2 kv)
6271    put = new Put(row4);
6272    put.add(kv4_5_1);
6273    put.add(kv4_5_3);
6274    region.put(put);
6275    put = new Put(row1);
6276    put.add(kv1_2_2);
6277    region.put(put);
6278    put = new Put(row2);
6279    put.add(kv2_4_4);
6280    region.put(put);
6281    region.flush(true);
6282    // hfiles(cf1/cf3) : "row2"(2 kv) / "row3"(1 kvs) / "row4" (1 kv)
6283    put = new Put(row4);
6284    put.add(kv4_5_2);
6285    region.put(put);
6286    put = new Put(row2);
6287    put.add(kv2_4_2);
6288    put.add(kv2_4_3);
6289    region.put(put);
6290    put = new Put(row3);
6291    put.add(kv3_2_2);
6292    region.put(put);
6293    region.flush(true);
6294    // memstore(cf1/cf2/cf3) : "row0" (1 kvs) / "row3" ( 1 kv) / "row5" (max)
6295    // ( 2 kv)
6296    put = new Put(row0);
6297    put.add(kv0_1_1);
6298    region.put(put);
6299    put = new Put(row3);
6300    put.add(kv3_2_1);
6301    region.put(put);
6302    put = new Put(row5);
6303    put.add(kv5_2_1);
6304    put.add(kv5_2_2);
6305    region.put(put);
6306    // scan range = ["row4", min), skip the max "row5"
6307    Scan scan = new Scan().withStartRow(row4);
6308    scan.readVersions(5);
6309    scan.setBatch(3);
6310    scan.setReversed(true);
6311    try (InternalScanner scanner = region.getScanner(scan)) {
6312      List<Cell> currRow = new ArrayList<>();
6313      boolean hasNext = false;
6314      // 1. scan out "row4" (5 kvs), "row5" can't be scanned out since not
6315      // included in scan range
6316      // "row4" takes 2 next() calls since batch=3
6317      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6318      assertEquals(3, currRow.size());
6319      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6320        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), row4, 0, row4.length));
6321      assertTrue(hasNext);
6322      currRow.clear();
6323      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6324      assertEquals(2, currRow.size());
6325      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6326        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), row4, 0, row4.length));
6327      assertTrue(hasNext);
6328      // 2. scan out "row3" (2 kv)
6329      currRow.clear();
6330      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6331      assertEquals(2, currRow.size());
6332      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6333        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), row3, 0, row3.length));
6334      assertTrue(hasNext);
6335      // 3. scan out "row2" (4 kvs)
6336      // "row2" takes 2 next() calls since batch=3
6337      currRow.clear();
6338      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6339      assertEquals(3, currRow.size());
6340      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6341        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), row2, 0, row2.length));
6342      assertTrue(hasNext);
6343      currRow.clear();
6344      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6345      assertEquals(1, currRow.size());
6346      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6347        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), row2, 0, row2.length));
6348      assertTrue(hasNext);
6349      // 4. scan out "row1" (2 kv)
6350      currRow.clear();
6351      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6352      assertEquals(2, currRow.size());
6353      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6354        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), row1, 0, row1.length));
6355      assertTrue(hasNext);
6356      // 5. scan out "row0" (1 kv)
6357      currRow.clear();
6358      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6359      assertEquals(1, currRow.size());
6360      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6361        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), row0, 0, row0.length));
6362      assertFalse(hasNext);
6363    }
6364  }

6426      assertTrue(Bytes.equals(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(), currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(),
6427        currRow.get(0).getRowLength(), row2, 0, row2.length));
6428      assertTrue(hasNext);
6429      currRow.clear();
6430      hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);

6438  /**
6439   * Test for HBASE-14497: Reverse Scan threw StackOverflow caused by readPt checking
6440   */
6441  @Test
6442  public void testReverseScanner_StackOverflow() throws IOException {
6443    byte[] cf1 = Bytes.toBytes("CF1");
6444    byte[][] families = { cf1 };
6445    byte[] col = Bytes.toBytes("C");
6446    Configuration conf = new Configuration(CONF);
6447    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, conf, families);
6448    // setup with one storefile and one memstore, to create scanner and get an earlier readPt
6449    Put put = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("19998"));
6450    put.addColumn(cf1, col, Bytes.toBytes("val"));
6451    region.put(put);
6452    region.flushcache(true, true, FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
6453    Put put2 = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("19997"));
6454    put2.addColumn(cf1, col, Bytes.toBytes("val"));
6455    region.put(put2);
6456
6457    Scan scan = new Scan().withStartRow(Bytes.toBytes("19998"));
6458    scan.setReversed(true);
6459    try (InternalScanner scanner = region.getScanner(scan)) {
6460      // create one storefile contains many rows will be skipped
6461      // to check StoreFileScanner.seekToPreviousRow
6462      for (int i = 10000; i < 20000; i++) {
6463        Put p = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("" + i));
6464        p.addColumn(cf1, col, Bytes.toBytes("" + i));
6465        region.put(p);
6466      }
6467      region.flushcache(true, true, FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
6468
6469      // create one memstore contains many rows will be skipped
6470      // to check MemStoreScanner.seekToPreviousRow
6471      for (int i = 10000; i < 20000; i++) {
6472        Put p = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("" + i));
6473        p.addColumn(cf1, col, Bytes.toBytes("" + i));
6474        region.put(p);
6475      }
6476
6477      List<Cell> currRow = new ArrayList<>();
6478      boolean hasNext;
6479      do {
6480        hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6481      } while (hasNext);
6482      assertEquals(2, currRow.size());
6483      assertEquals("19998", Bytes.toString(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(),
6484        currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(), currRow.get(0).getRowLength()));
6485      assertEquals("19997", Bytes.toString(currRow.get(1).getRowArray(),
6486        currRow.get(1).getRowOffset(), currRow.get(1).getRowLength()));
6487    }
6488  }

6490  @Test
6491  public void testReverseScanShouldNotScanMemstoreIfReadPtLesser() throws Exception {
6492    byte[] cf1 = Bytes.toBytes("CF1");
6493    byte[][] families = { cf1 };
6494    byte[] col = Bytes.toBytes("C");
6495    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, families);
6496    // setup with one storefile and one memstore, to create scanner and get an earlier readPt
6497    Put put = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("19996"));
6498    put.addColumn(cf1, col, Bytes.toBytes("val"));
6499    region.put(put);
6500    Put put2 = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("19995"));
6501    put2.addColumn(cf1, col, Bytes.toBytes("val"));
6502    region.put(put2);
6503    // create a reverse scan
6504    Scan scan = new Scan().withStartRow(Bytes.toBytes("19996"));
6505    scan.setReversed(true);
6506    try (RegionScannerImpl scanner = region.getScanner(scan)) {
6507      // flush the cache. This will reset the store scanner
6508      region.flushcache(true, true, FlushLifeCycleTracker.DUMMY);
6509
6510      // create one memstore contains many rows will be skipped
6511      // to check MemStoreScanner.seekToPreviousRow
6512      for (int i = 10000; i < 20000; i++) {
6513        Put p = new Put(Bytes.toBytes("" + i));
6514        p.addColumn(cf1, col, Bytes.toBytes("" + i));
6515        region.put(p);
6516      }
6517      List<Cell> currRow = new ArrayList<>();
6518      boolean hasNext;
6519      boolean assertDone = false;
6520      do {
6521        hasNext = scanner.next(currRow);
6522        // With HBASE-15871, after the scanner is reset the memstore scanner should not be
6523        // added here
6524        if (!assertDone) {
6525          StoreScanner current = (StoreScanner) (scanner.storeHeap).getCurrentForTesting();
6526          List<KeyValueScanner> scanners = current.getAllScannersForTesting();
6527          assertEquals("There should be only one scanner the store file scanner", 1,
6528            scanners.size());
6529          assertDone = true;
6530        }
6531      } while (hasNext);
6532      assertEquals(2, currRow.size());
6533      assertEquals("19996", Bytes.toString(currRow.get(0).getRowArray(),
6534        currRow.get(0).getRowOffset(), currRow.get(0).getRowLength()));
6535      assertEquals("19995", Bytes.toString(currRow.get(1).getRowArray(),
6536        currRow.get(1).getRowOffset(), currRow.get(1).getRowLength()));
6537    }
6538  }

6579  @Test
6580  public void testWriteRequestsCounter() throws IOException {
6581    byte[] fam = Bytes.toBytes("info");
6582    byte[][] families = { fam };
6583    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, families);
6584
6585    Assert.assertEquals(0L, region.getWriteRequestsCount());
6586
6587    Put put = new Put(row);
6588    put.addColumn(fam, fam, fam);
6589
6590    Assert.assertEquals(0L, region.getWriteRequestsCount());
6591    region.put(put);
6592    Assert.assertEquals(1L, region.getWriteRequestsCount());
6593    region.put(put);
6594    Assert.assertEquals(2L, region.getWriteRequestsCount());
6595    region.put(put);
6596    Assert.assertEquals(3L, region.getWriteRequestsCount());
6597
6598    region.delete(new Delete(row));
6599    Assert.assertEquals(4L, region.getWriteRequestsCount());
6600  }

6602  @Test
6603  public void testOpenRegionWrittenToWAL() throws Exception {
6604    final ServerName serverName = ServerName.valueOf(name.getMethodName(), 100, 42);
6605    final RegionServerServices rss = spy(TEST_UTIL.createMockRegionServerService(serverName));
6606
6607    TableDescriptor htd = TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(TableName.valueOf(name.getMethodName()))
6608      .setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.of(fam1))
6609      .setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.of(fam2)).build();
6610    RegionInfo hri = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(htd.getTableName()).build();
6611
6612    // open the region w/o rss and wal and flush some files
6613    region = HBaseTestingUtil.createRegionAndWAL(hri, TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir(),
6614      TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), htd);
6615    assertNotNull(region);
6616
6617    // create a file in fam1 for the region before opening in OpenRegionHandler
6618    region.put(new Put(Bytes.toBytes("a")).addColumn(fam1, fam1, fam1));
6619    region.flush(true);
6620    HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(region);
6621
6622    ArgumentCaptor<WALEdit> editCaptor = ArgumentCaptor.forClass(WALEdit.class);
6623
6624    // capture append() calls
6625    WAL wal = mockWAL();
6626    when(rss.getWAL(any(RegionInfo.class))).thenReturn(wal);
6627
6628    region =
6629      HRegion.openHRegion(hri, htd, rss.getWAL(hri), TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), rss, null);
6630
6631    verify(wal, times(1)).appendMarker(any(RegionInfo.class), any(WALKeyImpl.class),
6632      editCaptor.capture());
6633
6634    WALEdit edit = editCaptor.getValue();
6635    assertNotNull(edit);
6636    assertNotNull(edit.getCells());
6637    assertEquals(1, edit.getCells().size());
6638    RegionEventDescriptor desc = WALEdit.getRegionEventDescriptor(edit.getCells().get(0));
6639    assertNotNull(desc);
6640
6641    LOG.info("RegionEventDescriptor from WAL: " + desc);
6642
6643    assertEquals(RegionEventDescriptor.EventType.REGION_OPEN, desc.getEventType());
6644    assertTrue(Bytes.equals(desc.getTableName().toByteArray(), htd.getTableName().toBytes()));
6645    assertTrue(
6646      Bytes.equals(desc.getEncodedRegionName().toByteArray(), hri.getEncodedNameAsBytes()));
6647    assertTrue(desc.getLogSequenceNumber() > 0);
6648    assertEquals(serverName, ProtobufUtil.toServerName(desc.getServer()));
6649    assertEquals(2, desc.getStoresCount());
6650
6651    StoreDescriptor store = desc.getStores(0);
6652    assertTrue(Bytes.equals(store.getFamilyName().toByteArray(), fam1));
6653    assertEquals(store.getStoreHomeDir(), Bytes.toString(fam1));
6654    assertEquals(1, store.getStoreFileCount()); // 1store file
6655    assertFalse(store.getStoreFile(0).contains("/")); // ensure path is relative
6656
6657    store = desc.getStores(1);
6658    assertTrue(Bytes.equals(store.getFamilyName().toByteArray(), fam2));
6659    assertEquals(store.getStoreHomeDir(), Bytes.toString(fam2));
6660    assertEquals(0, store.getStoreFileCount()); // no store files
6661  }

6698  /**
6699   * Utility method to setup a WAL mock.
6700   * <p/>
6701   * Needs to do the bit where we close latch on the WALKeyImpl on append else test hangs.
6702   * @return a mock WAL
6703   */
6704  private WAL mockWAL() throws IOException {
6705    WAL wal = mock(WAL.class);
6706    when(wal.appendData(any(RegionInfo.class), any(WALKeyImpl.class), any(WALEdit.class)))
6707      .thenAnswer(new Answer<Long>() {
6708        @Override
6709        public Long answer(InvocationOnMock invocation) throws Throwable {
6710          WALKeyImpl key = invocation.getArgument(1);
6711          MultiVersionConcurrencyControl.WriteEntry we = key.getMvcc().begin();
6712          key.setWriteEntry(we);
6713          return 1L;
6714        }
6715      });
6716    when(wal.appendMarker(any(RegionInfo.class), any(WALKeyImpl.class), any(WALEdit.class)))
6717      .thenAnswer(new Answer<Long>() {
6718        @Override
6719        public Long answer(InvocationOnMock invocation) throws Throwable {
6720          WALKeyImpl key = invocation.getArgument(1);
6721          MultiVersionConcurrencyControl.WriteEntry we = key.getMvcc().begin();
6722          key.setWriteEntry(we);
6723          return 1L;
6724        }
6725      });
6726    return wal;
6727  }

6729  @Test
6730  public void testCloseRegionWrittenToWAL() throws Exception {
6731    Path rootDir = new Path(dir + name.getMethodName());
6732    CommonFSUtils.setRootDir(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), rootDir);
6733
6734    final ServerName serverName = ServerName.valueOf("testCloseRegionWrittenToWAL", 100, 42);
6735    final RegionServerServices rss = spy(TEST_UTIL.createMockRegionServerService(serverName));
6736
6737    TableDescriptor htd = TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(TableName.valueOf(name.getMethodName()))
6738      .setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.of(fam1))
6739      .setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.of(fam2)).build();
6740    RegionInfo hri = RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(htd.getTableName()).build();
6741
6742    ArgumentCaptor<WALEdit> editCaptor = ArgumentCaptor.forClass(WALEdit.class);
6743
6744    // capture append() calls

6746    when(rss.getWAL(any(RegionInfo.class))).thenReturn(wal);
6747
6748    // create the region

6750    HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(region);
6751    region = null;
6752    // open the region first and then close it
6753    HRegion.openHRegion(hri, htd, rss.getWAL(hri), TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), rss, null).close();
6754
6755    // 2 times, one for region open, the other close region
6756    verify(wal, times(2)).appendMarker(any(RegionInfo.class), (WALKeyImpl) any(WALKeyImpl.class),
6757      editCaptor.capture());

6762    assertEquals(1, edit.getCells().size());

6764    assertNotNull(desc);
6765
6766    LOG.info("RegionEventDescriptor from WAL: " + desc);
6767
6768    assertEquals(RegionEventDescriptor.EventType.REGION_CLOSE, desc.getEventType());
6769    assertTrue(Bytes.equals(desc.getTableName().toByteArray(), htd.getTableName().toBytes()));
6770    assertTrue(
6771      Bytes.equals(desc.getEncodedRegionName().toByteArray(), hri.getEncodedNameAsBytes()));
6772    assertTrue(desc.getLogSequenceNumber() > 0);
6773    assertEquals(serverName, ProtobufUtil.toServerName(desc.getServer()));
6774    assertEquals(2, desc.getStoresCount());
6775
6776    StoreDescriptor store = desc.getStores(0);
6777    assertTrue(Bytes.equals(store.getFamilyName().toByteArray(), fam1));
6778    assertEquals(store.getStoreHomeDir(), Bytes.toString(fam1));
6779    assertEquals(0, store.getStoreFileCount()); // no store files
6780
6781    store = desc.getStores(1);
6782    assertTrue(Bytes.equals(store.getFamilyName().toByteArray(), fam2));
6783    assertEquals(store.getStoreHomeDir(), Bytes.toString(fam2));
6784    assertEquals(0, store.getStoreFileCount()); // no store files
6785  }

6787  /**
6788   * Test RegionTooBusyException thrown when region is busy
6789   */
6790  @Test
6791  public void testRegionTooBusy() throws IOException {
6792    byte[] family = Bytes.toBytes("family");
6793    long defaultBusyWaitDuration =
6794      CONF.getLong("hbase.busy.wait.duration", HRegion.DEFAULT_BUSY_WAIT_DURATION);
6795    CONF.setLong("hbase.busy.wait.duration", 1000);
6796    region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, family);
6797    final AtomicBoolean stopped = new AtomicBoolean(true);
6798    Thread t = new Thread(new Runnable() {
6799      @Override
6800      public void run() {
6801        try {
6802          region.lock.writeLock().lock();
6803          stopped.set(false);
6804          while (!stopped.get()) {
6805            Thread.sleep(100);
6806          }
6807        } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
6808        } finally {
6809          region.lock.writeLock().unlock();
6810        }
6811      }
6812    });
6813    t.start();
6814    Get get = new Get(row);
6815    try {
6816      while (stopped.get()) {
6817        Thread.sleep(100);
6818      }
6819      region.get(get);
6820      fail("Should throw RegionTooBusyException");
6821    } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
6822      fail("test interrupted");
6823    } catch (RegionTooBusyException e) {
6824      // Good, expected
6825    } finally {
6826      stopped.set(true);
6827      try {
6828        t.join();
6829      } catch (Throwable e) {
6830      }
6831
6832      HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(region);
6833      region = null;
6834      CONF.setLong("hbase.busy.wait.duration", defaultBusyWaitDuration);
6835    }
6836  }
6837
6838  @Test
6839  public void testCellTTLs() throws IOException {
6840    IncrementingEnvironmentEdge edge = new IncrementingEnvironmentEdge();
6841    EnvironmentEdgeManager.injectEdge(edge);
6842
6843    final byte[] row = Bytes.toBytes("testRow");
6844    final byte[] q1 = Bytes.toBytes("q1");
6845    final byte[] q2 = Bytes.toBytes("q2");
6846    final byte[] q3 = Bytes.toBytes("q3");
6847    final byte[] q4 = Bytes.toBytes("q4");
6848
6849    // 10 seconds
6850    TableDescriptor tableDescriptor =
6851      TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(TableName.valueOf(name.getMethodName()))
6852        .setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(fam1).setTimeToLive(10).build())
6853        .build();
6854
6855    Configuration conf = new Configuration(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration());
6856    conf.setInt(HFile.FORMAT_VERSION_KEY, HFile.MIN_FORMAT_VERSION_WITH_TAGS);
6857
6858    region = HBaseTestingUtil.createRegionAndWAL(
6859      RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(tableDescriptor.getTableName()).build(),
6860      TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir(), conf, tableDescriptor);
6861    assertNotNull(region);
6862    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
6863    // Add a cell that will expire in 5 seconds via cell TTL
6864    region.put(new Put(row).add(new KeyValue(row, fam1, q1, now, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY,
6865      new ArrayBackedTag[] {
6866        // TTL tags specify ts in milliseconds
6867        new ArrayBackedTag(TagType.TTL_TAG_TYPE, Bytes.toBytes(5000L)) })));
6868    // Add a cell that will expire after 10 seconds via family setting
6869    region.put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q2, now, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY));
6870    // Add a cell that will expire in 15 seconds via cell TTL
6871    region.put(new Put(row).add(new KeyValue(row, fam1, q3, now + 10000 - 1,
6872      HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY, new ArrayBackedTag[] {
6873        // TTL tags specify ts in milliseconds
6874        new ArrayBackedTag(TagType.TTL_TAG_TYPE, Bytes.toBytes(5000L)) })));
6875    // Add a cell that will expire in 20 seconds via family setting
6876    region.put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q4, now + 10000 - 1, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY));
6877
6878    // Flush so we are sure store scanning gets this right
6879    region.flush(true);
6880
6881    // A query at time T+0 should return all cells
6882    Result r = region.get(new Get(row));
6883    assertNotNull(r.getValue(fam1, q1));
6884    assertNotNull(r.getValue(fam1, q2));
6885    assertNotNull(r.getValue(fam1, q3));
6886    assertNotNull(r.getValue(fam1, q4));
6887
6888    // Increment time to T+5 seconds
6889    edge.incrementTime(5000);
6890
6891    r = region.get(new Get(row));
6892    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q1));
6893    assertNotNull(r.getValue(fam1, q2));
6894    assertNotNull(r.getValue(fam1, q3));
6895    assertNotNull(r.getValue(fam1, q4));
6896
6897    // Increment time to T+10 seconds
6898    edge.incrementTime(5000);
6899
6900    r = region.get(new Get(row));
6901    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q1));
6902    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q2));
6903    assertNotNull(r.getValue(fam1, q3));
6904    assertNotNull(r.getValue(fam1, q4));
6905
6906    // Increment time to T+15 seconds
6907    edge.incrementTime(5000);
6908
6909    r = region.get(new Get(row));
6910    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q1));
6911    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q2));
6912    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q3));
6913    assertNotNull(r.getValue(fam1, q4));
6914
6915    // Increment time to T+20 seconds
6916    edge.incrementTime(10000);
6917
6918    r = region.get(new Get(row));
6919    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q1));
6920    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q2));
6921    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q3));
6922    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q4));
6923
6924    // Fun with disappearing increments
6925
6926    // Start at 1
6927    region.put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q1, Bytes.toBytes(1L)));
6928    r = region.get(new Get(row));
6929    byte[] val = r.getValue(fam1, q1);
6930    assertNotNull(val);
6931    assertEquals(1L, Bytes.toLong(val));
6932
6933    // Increment with a TTL of 5 seconds
6934    Increment incr = new Increment(row).addColumn(fam1, q1, 1L);
6935    incr.setTTL(5000);
6936    region.increment(incr); // 2
6937
6938    // New value should be 2
6939    r = region.get(new Get(row));
6940    val = r.getValue(fam1, q1);
6941    assertNotNull(val);
6942    assertEquals(2L, Bytes.toLong(val));
6943
6944    // Increment time to T+25 seconds
6945    edge.incrementTime(5000);
6946
6947    // Value should be back to 1
6948    r = region.get(new Get(row));
6949    val = r.getValue(fam1, q1);
6950    assertNotNull(val);
6951    assertEquals(1L, Bytes.toLong(val));
6952
6953    // Increment time to T+30 seconds
6954    edge.incrementTime(5000);
6955
6956    // Original value written at T+20 should be gone now via family TTL
6957    r = region.get(new Get(row));
6958    assertNull(r.getValue(fam1, q1));
6959  }

6961  @Test
6962  public void testTTLsUsingSmallHeartBeatCells() throws IOException {
6963    IncrementingEnvironmentEdge edge = new IncrementingEnvironmentEdge();
6964    EnvironmentEdgeManager.injectEdge(edge);
6965
6966    final byte[] row = Bytes.toBytes("testRow");
6967    final byte[] q1 = Bytes.toBytes("q1");
6968    final byte[] q2 = Bytes.toBytes("q2");
6969    final byte[] q3 = Bytes.toBytes("q3");
6970    final byte[] q4 = Bytes.toBytes("q4");
6971    final byte[] q5 = Bytes.toBytes("q5");
6972    final byte[] q6 = Bytes.toBytes("q6");
6973    final byte[] q7 = Bytes.toBytes("q7");
6974    final byte[] q8 = Bytes.toBytes("q8");
6975
6976    // 10 seconds
6977    int ttlSecs = 10;
6978    TableDescriptor tableDescriptor =
6979      TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(TableName.valueOf(name.getMethodName())).setColumnFamily(
6980        ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(fam1).setTimeToLive(ttlSecs).build()).build();
6981
6982    Configuration conf = new Configuration(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration());
6983    conf.setInt(HFile.FORMAT_VERSION_KEY, HFile.MIN_FORMAT_VERSION_WITH_TAGS);
6984    // using small heart beat cells
6985    conf.setLong(StoreScanner.HBASE_CELLS_SCANNED_PER_HEARTBEAT_CHECK, 2);
6986
6987    region = HBaseTestingUtil.createRegionAndWAL(
6988      RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(tableDescriptor.getTableName()).build(),
6989      TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir(), conf, tableDescriptor);
6990    assertNotNull(region);
6991    long now = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime();
6992    // Add a cell that will expire in 5 seconds via cell TTL
6993    region.put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q1, now, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY));
6994    region.put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q2, now, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY));
6995    region.put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q3, now, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY));
6996    // Add a cell that will expire after 10 seconds via family setting
6997    region
6998      .put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q4, now + ttlSecs * 1000 + 1, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY));
6999    region
7000      .put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q5, now + ttlSecs * 1000 + 1, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY));
7001
7002    region.put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q6, now, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY));
7003    region.put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q7, now, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY));
7004    region
7005      .put(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q8, now + ttlSecs * 1000 + 1, HConstants.EMPTY_BYTE_ARRAY));
7006
7007    // Flush so we are sure store scanning gets this right
7008    region.flush(true);
7009
7010    // A query at time T+0 should return all cells
7011    checkScan(8);
7012    region.delete(new Delete(row).addColumn(fam1, q8));
7013
7014    // Increment time to T+ttlSecs seconds
7015    edge.incrementTime(ttlSecs * 1000);
7016    checkScan(2);
7017  }
7018
7019  private void checkScan(int expectCellSize) throws IOException {
7020    Scan s = new Scan().withStartRow(row);
7021    ScannerContext.Builder contextBuilder = ScannerContext.newBuilder(true);
7022    ScannerContext scannerContext = contextBuilder.build();
7023    try (RegionScanner scanner = region.getScanner(s)) {
7024      List<Cell> kvs = new ArrayList<>();
7025      scanner.next(kvs, scannerContext);
7026      assertEquals(expectCellSize, kvs.size());
7027    }
7028  }

7030  @Test
7031  public void testIncrementTimestampsAreMonotonic() throws IOException {
7032    region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, fam1);
7033    ManualEnvironmentEdge edge = new ManualEnvironmentEdge();
7034    EnvironmentEdgeManager.injectEdge(edge);
7035
7036    edge.setValue(10);
7037    Increment inc = new Increment(row);
7038    inc.setDurability(Durability.SKIP_WAL);
7039    inc.addColumn(fam1, qual1, 1L);
7040    region.increment(inc);
7041
7042    Result result = region.get(new Get(row));
7043    Cell c = result.getColumnLatestCell(fam1, qual1);
7044    assertNotNull(c);
7045    assertEquals(10L, c.getTimestamp());
7046
7047    edge.setValue(1); // clock goes back
7048    region.increment(inc);
7049    result = region.get(new Get(row));
7050    c = result.getColumnLatestCell(fam1, qual1);
7051    assertEquals(11L, c.getTimestamp());
7052    assertEquals(2L, Bytes.toLong(c.getValueArray(), c.getValueOffset(), c.getValueLength()));
7053  }

7055  @Test
7056  public void testAppendTimestampsAreMonotonic() throws IOException {
7057    region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, fam1);
7058    ManualEnvironmentEdge edge = new ManualEnvironmentEdge();
7059    EnvironmentEdgeManager.injectEdge(edge);
7060
7061    edge.setValue(10);

7063    a.setDurability(Durability.SKIP_WAL);
7064    a.addColumn(fam1, qual1, qual1);
7065    region.append(a);
7066
7067    Result result = region.get(new Get(row));
7068    Cell c = result.getColumnLatestCell(fam1, qual1);

7080    System.arraycopy(qual1, 0, expected, qual1.length, qual1.length);
7081

7083      expected.length));

7116  @Test
7117  public void testBatchMutateWithWrongRegionException() throws Exception {
7118    final byte[] a = Bytes.toBytes("a");
7119    final byte[] b = Bytes.toBytes("b");
7120    final byte[] c = Bytes.toBytes("c"); // exclusive
7121
7122    int prevLockTimeout = CONF.getInt("hbase.rowlock.wait.duration", 30000);
7123    CONF.setInt("hbase.rowlock.wait.duration", 1000);
7124    region = initHRegion(tableName, a, c, method, CONF, false, fam1);
7125
7126    Mutation[] mutations = new Mutation[] {
7127      new Put(a).add(CellBuilderFactory.create(CellBuilderType.SHALLOW_COPY).setRow(a)
7128        .setFamily(fam1).setTimestamp(HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP).setType(Cell.Type.Put).build()),
7129      // this is outside the region boundary
7130      new Put(c).add(CellBuilderFactory.create(CellBuilderType.SHALLOW_COPY).setRow(c)
7131        .setFamily(fam1).setTimestamp(HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP).setType(Type.Put).build()),
7132      new Put(b)
7133        .add(CellBuilderFactory.create(CellBuilderType.SHALLOW_COPY).setRow(b).setFamily(fam1)
7134          .setTimestamp(HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP).setType(Cell.Type.Put).build()) };
7135
7136    OperationStatus[] status = region.batchMutate(mutations);
7137    assertEquals(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, status[0].getOperationStatusCode());
7138    assertEquals(OperationStatusCode.SANITY_CHECK_FAILURE, status[1].getOperationStatusCode());
7139    assertEquals(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, status[2].getOperationStatusCode());
7140
7141    // test with a row lock held for a long time
7142    final CountDownLatch obtainedRowLock = new CountDownLatch(1);
7143    ExecutorService exec = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(2);
7144    Future<Void> f1 = exec.submit(new Callable<Void>() {
7145      @Override
7146      public Void call() throws Exception {
7147        LOG.info("Acquiring row lock");
7148        RowLock rl = region.getRowLock(b);
7149        obtainedRowLock.countDown();
7150        LOG.info("Waiting for 5 seconds before releasing lock");
7151        Threads.sleep(5000);
7152        LOG.info("Releasing row lock");
7153        rl.release();
7154        return null;
7155      }
7156    });
7157    obtainedRowLock.await(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
7158
7159    Future<Void> f2 = exec.submit(new Callable<Void>() {
7160      @Override
7161      public Void call() throws Exception {
7162        Mutation[] mutations = new Mutation[] {
7163          new Put(a)
7164            .add(CellBuilderFactory.create(CellBuilderType.SHALLOW_COPY).setRow(a).setFamily(fam1)
7165              .setTimestamp(HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP).setType(Cell.Type.Put).build()),
7166          new Put(b)
7167            .add(CellBuilderFactory.create(CellBuilderType.SHALLOW_COPY).setRow(b).setFamily(fam1)
7168              .setTimestamp(HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP).setType(Cell.Type.Put).build()), };
7169
7170        // this will wait for the row lock, and it will eventually succeed
7171        OperationStatus[] status = region.batchMutate(mutations);
7172        assertEquals(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, status[0].getOperationStatusCode());
7173        assertEquals(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, status[1].getOperationStatusCode());
7174        return null;
7175      }
7176    });
7177
7178    f1.get();
7179    f2.get();
7180
7181    CONF.setInt("hbase.rowlock.wait.duration", prevLockTimeout);
7182  }

7184  @Test
7185  public void testBatchMutateWithZeroRowLockWait() throws Exception {
7186    final byte[] a = Bytes.toBytes("a");
7187    final byte[] b = Bytes.toBytes("b");
7188    final byte[] c = Bytes.toBytes("c"); // exclusive
7189
7190    Configuration conf = new Configuration(CONF);
7191    conf.setInt("hbase.rowlock.wait.duration", 0);
7192    final RegionInfo hri =
7193      RegionInfoBuilder.newBuilder(tableName).setStartKey(a).setEndKey(c).build();
7194    final TableDescriptor htd = TableDescriptorBuilder.newBuilder(tableName)
7195      .setColumnFamily(ColumnFamilyDescriptorBuilder.of(fam1)).build();
7196    region = HRegion.createHRegion(hri, TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDir(), conf, htd,
7197      HBaseTestingUtil.createWal(conf, TEST_UTIL.getDataTestDirOnTestFS(method + ".log"), hri));
7198
7199    Mutation[] mutations = new Mutation[] {
7200      new Put(a).add(CellBuilderFactory.create(CellBuilderType.SHALLOW_COPY).setRow(a)
7201        .setFamily(fam1).setTimestamp(HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP).setType(Cell.Type.Put).build()),
7202      new Put(b)
7203        .add(CellBuilderFactory.create(CellBuilderType.SHALLOW_COPY).setRow(b).setFamily(fam1)
7204          .setTimestamp(HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP).setType(Cell.Type.Put).build()) };
7205
7206    OperationStatus[] status = region.batchMutate(mutations);
7207    assertEquals(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, status[0].getOperationStatusCode());
7208    assertEquals(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, status[1].getOperationStatusCode());
7209
7210    // test with a row lock held for a long time
7211    final CountDownLatch obtainedRowLock = new CountDownLatch(1);
7212    ExecutorService exec = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(2);
7213    Future<Void> f1 = exec.submit(new Callable<Void>() {
7214      @Override
7215      public Void call() throws Exception {
7216        LOG.info("Acquiring row lock");
7217        RowLock rl = region.getRowLock(b);
7218        obtainedRowLock.countDown();
7219        LOG.info("Waiting for 5 seconds before releasing lock");
7220        Threads.sleep(5000);
7221        LOG.info("Releasing row lock");
7222        rl.release();
7223        return null;
7224      }
7225    });
7226    obtainedRowLock.await(30, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
7227
7228    Future<Void> f2 = exec.submit(new Callable<Void>() {
7229      @Override
7230      public Void call() throws Exception {
7231        Mutation[] mutations = new Mutation[] {
7232          new Put(a)
7233            .add(CellBuilderFactory.create(CellBuilderType.SHALLOW_COPY).setRow(a).setFamily(fam1)
7234              .setTimestamp(HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP).setType(Cell.Type.Put).build()),
7235          new Put(b)
7236            .add(CellBuilderFactory.create(CellBuilderType.SHALLOW_COPY).setRow(b).setFamily(fam1)
7237              .setTimestamp(HConstants.LATEST_TIMESTAMP).setType(Cell.Type.Put).build()), };
7238        // when handling row b we are going to spin on the failure to get the row lock
7239        // until the lock above is released, but we will still succeed so long as that
7240        // takes less time then the test time out.
7241        OperationStatus[] status = region.batchMutate(mutations);
7242        assertEquals(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, status[0].getOperationStatusCode());
7243        assertEquals(OperationStatusCode.SUCCESS, status[1].getOperationStatusCode());
7244        return null;
7245      }
7246    });
7247
7248    f1.get();
7249    f2.get();
7250  }

7252  @Test
7253  public void testCheckAndRowMutateTimestampsAreMonotonic() throws IOException {
7254    region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, fam1);
7255    ManualEnvironmentEdge edge = new ManualEnvironmentEdge();
7256    EnvironmentEdgeManager.injectEdge(edge);
7257
7258    edge.setValue(10);
7259    Put p = new Put(row);
7260    p.setDurability(Durability.SKIP_WAL);
7261    p.addColumn(fam1, qual1, qual1);
7262    region.put(p);
7263
7264    Result result = region.get(new Get(row));
7265    Cell c = result.getColumnLatestCell(fam1, qual1);
7266    assertNotNull(c);
7267    assertEquals(10L, c.getTimestamp());
7268
7269    edge.setValue(1); // clock goes back
7270    p = new Put(row);
7271    p.setDurability(Durability.SKIP_WAL);
7272    p.addColumn(fam1, qual1, qual2);
7273    RowMutations rm = new RowMutations(row);

7279    assertEquals(10L, c.getTimestamp());
7280    LOG.info(
7281      "c value " + Bytes.toStringBinary(c.getValueArray(), c.getValueOffset(), c.getValueLength()));
7282
7283    assertTrue(Bytes.equals(c.getValueArray(), c.getValueOffset(), c.getValueLength(), qual2, 0,
7284      qual2.length));
7285  }

7292  /**
7293   * HBASE-16429 Make sure no stuck if roll writer when ring buffer is filled with appends
7294   * @throws IOException if IO error occurred during test
7295   */
7296  @Test
7297  public void testWritesWhileRollWriter() throws IOException {
7298    int testCount = 10;
7299    int numRows = 1024;
7300    int numFamilies = 2;
7301    int numQualifiers = 2;
7302    final byte[][] families = new byte[numFamilies][];
7303    for (int i = 0; i < numFamilies; i++) {
7304      families[i] = Bytes.toBytes("family" + i);
7305    }
7306    final byte[][] qualifiers = new byte[numQualifiers][];
7307    for (int i = 0; i < numQualifiers; i++) {
7308      qualifiers[i] = Bytes.toBytes("qual" + i);
7309    }
7310
7311    CONF.setInt("hbase.regionserver.wal.disruptor.event.count", 2);
7312    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, families);
7313    try {
7314      List<Thread> threads = new ArrayList<>();
7315      for (int i = 0; i < numRows; i++) {
7316        final int count = i;
7317        Thread t = new Thread(new Runnable() {
7318
7319          @Override
7320          public void run() {
7321            byte[] row = Bytes.toBytes("row" + count);
7322            Put put = new Put(row);
7323            put.setDurability(Durability.SYNC_WAL);
7324            byte[] value = Bytes.toBytes(String.valueOf(count));
7325            for (byte[] family : families) {
7326              for (byte[] qualifier : qualifiers) {
7327                put.addColumn(family, qualifier, count, value);
7328              }
7329            }
7330            try {
7331              region.put(put);
7332            } catch (IOException e) {
7333              throw new RuntimeException(e);
7334            }
7335          }
7336        });
7337        threads.add(t);
7338      }
7339      for (Thread t : threads) {
7340        t.start();
7341      }
7342
7343      for (int i = 0; i < testCount; i++) {
7344        region.getWAL().rollWriter();
7345        Thread.yield();
7346      }
7347    } finally {
7348      try {
7349        HBaseTestingUtil.closeRegionAndWAL(this.region);
7350        CONF.setInt("hbase.regionserver.wal.disruptor.event.count", 16 * 1024);
7351      } catch (DroppedSnapshotException dse) {
7352        // We could get this on way out because we interrupt the background flusher and it could
7353        // fail anywhere causing a DSE over in the background flusher... only it is not properly
7354        // dealt with so could still be memory hanging out when we get to here -- memory we can't
7355        // flush because the accounting is 'off' since original DSE.
7356      }
7357      this.region = null;
7358    }
7359  }

7361  @Test
7362  public void testMutateRow() throws Exception {
7363    final byte[] row = Bytes.toBytes("row");
7364    final byte[] q1 = Bytes.toBytes("q1");
7365    final byte[] q2 = Bytes.toBytes("q2");
7366    final byte[] q3 = Bytes.toBytes("q3");
7367    final byte[] q4 = Bytes.toBytes("q4");
7368    final String v1 = "v1";
7369
7370    region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, fam1);
7371
7372    // Initial values
7373    region
7374      .batchMutate(new Mutation[] { new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q2, Bytes.toBytes("toBeDeleted")),
7375        new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q3, Bytes.toBytes(5L)),
7376        new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q4, Bytes.toBytes("a")), });
7377
7378    // Do mutateRow
7379    Result result = region.mutateRow(
7380      new RowMutations(row).add(Arrays.asList(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q1, Bytes.toBytes(v1)),
7381        new Delete(row).addColumns(fam1, q2), new Increment(row).addColumn(fam1, q3, 1),
7382        new Append(row).addColumn(fam1, q4, Bytes.toBytes("b")))));
7383
7384    assertNotNull(result);
7385    assertEquals(6L, Bytes.toLong(result.getValue(fam1, q3)));
7386    assertEquals("ab", Bytes.toString(result.getValue(fam1, q4)));
7387
7388    // Verify the value
7389    result = region.get(new Get(row));
7390    assertEquals(v1, Bytes.toString(result.getValue(fam1, q1)));
7391    assertNull(result.getValue(fam1, q2));
7392    assertEquals(6L, Bytes.toLong(result.getValue(fam1, q3)));
7393    assertEquals("ab", Bytes.toString(result.getValue(fam1, q4)));
7394  }
7395
7396  @Test
7397  public void testMutateRowInParallel() throws Exception {
7398    final int numReaderThreads = 100;
7399    final CountDownLatch latch = new CountDownLatch(numReaderThreads);
7400
7401    final byte[] row = Bytes.toBytes("row");
7402    final byte[] q1 = Bytes.toBytes("q1");
7403    final byte[] q2 = Bytes.toBytes("q2");
7404    final byte[] q3 = Bytes.toBytes("q3");
7405    final byte[] q4 = Bytes.toBytes("q4");
7406    final String v1 = "v1";
7407    final String v2 = "v2";
7408
7409    // We need to ensure the timestamp of the delete operation is more than the previous one
7410    final AtomicLong deleteTimestamp = new AtomicLong();
7411
7412    region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, fam1);
7413
7414    // Initial values
7415    region.batchMutate(new Mutation[] { new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q1, Bytes.toBytes(v1))
7416      .addColumn(fam1, q2, deleteTimestamp.getAndIncrement(), Bytes.toBytes(v2))
7417      .addColumn(fam1, q3, Bytes.toBytes(1L)).addColumn(fam1, q4, Bytes.toBytes("a")) });
7418
7419    final AtomicReference<AssertionError> assertionError = new AtomicReference<>();
7420
7421    // Writer thread
7422    Thread writerThread = new Thread(() -> {
7423      try {
7424        while (true) {
7425          // If all the reader threads finish, then stop the writer thread
7426          if (latch.await(0, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS)) {
7427            return;
7428          }
7429
7430          // Execute the mutations. This should be done atomically
7431          region.mutateRow(new RowMutations(row)
7432            .add(Arrays.asList(new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q1, Bytes.toBytes(v2)),
7433              new Delete(row).addColumns(fam1, q2, deleteTimestamp.getAndIncrement()),
7434              new Increment(row).addColumn(fam1, q3, 1L),
7435              new Append(row).addColumn(fam1, q4, Bytes.toBytes("b")))));
7436
7437          // We need to ensure the timestamps of the Increment/Append operations are more than the
7438          // previous ones
7439          Result result = region.get(new Get(row).addColumn(fam1, q3).addColumn(fam1, q4));
7440          long tsIncrement = result.getColumnLatestCell(fam1, q3).getTimestamp();
7441          long tsAppend = result.getColumnLatestCell(fam1, q4).getTimestamp();
7442
7443          // Put the initial values
7444          region.batchMutate(new Mutation[] { new Put(row).addColumn(fam1, q1, Bytes.toBytes(v1))
7445            .addColumn(fam1, q2, deleteTimestamp.getAndIncrement(), Bytes.toBytes(v2))
7446            .addColumn(fam1, q3, tsIncrement + 1, Bytes.toBytes(1L))
7447            .addColumn(fam1, q4, tsAppend + 1, Bytes.toBytes("a")) });
7448        }
7449      } catch (Exception e) {
7450        assertionError.set(new AssertionError(e));
7451      }
7452    });
7453    writerThread.start();
7454
7455    // Reader threads
7456    for (int i = 0; i < numReaderThreads; i++) {
7457      new Thread(() -> {
7458        try {
7459          for (int j = 0; j < 10000; j++) {
7460            // Verify the values
7461            Result result = region.get(new Get(row));
7462
7463            // The values should be equals to either the initial values or the values after
7464            // executing the mutations
7465            String q1Value = Bytes.toString(result.getValue(fam1, q1));
7466            if (v1.equals(q1Value)) {
7467              assertEquals(v2, Bytes.toString(result.getValue(fam1, q2)));
7468              assertEquals(1L, Bytes.toLong(result.getValue(fam1, q3)));
7469              assertEquals("a", Bytes.toString(result.getValue(fam1, q4)));
7470            } else if (v2.equals(q1Value)) {
7471              assertNull(Bytes.toString(result.getValue(fam1, q2)));
7472              assertEquals(2L, Bytes.toLong(result.getValue(fam1, q3)));
7473              assertEquals("ab", Bytes.toString(result.getValue(fam1, q4)));
7474            } else {
7475              fail("the qualifier " + Bytes.toString(q1) + " should be " + v1 + " or " + v2
7476                + ", but " + q1Value);
7477            }
7478          }
7479        } catch (Exception e) {
7480          assertionError.set(new AssertionError(e));
7481        } catch (AssertionError e) {
7482          assertionError.set(e);
7483        }
7484
7485        latch.countDown();
7486      }).start();
7487    }
7488
7489    writerThread.join();
7490
7491    if (assertionError.get() != null) {
7492      throw assertionError.get();
7493    }
7494  }

7496  @Test
7497  public void testMutateRow_WriteRequestCount() throws Exception {
7498    byte[] row1 = Bytes.toBytes("row1");
7499    byte[] fam1 = Bytes.toBytes("fam1");
7500    byte[] qf1 = Bytes.toBytes("qualifier");
7501    byte[] val1 = Bytes.toBytes("value1");
7502
7503    RowMutations rm = new RowMutations(row1);
7504    Put put = new Put(row1);
7505    put.addColumn(fam1, qf1, val1);
7506    rm.add(put);
7507
7508    this.region = initHRegion(tableName, method, CONF, fam1);
7509    long wrcBeforeMutate = this.region.writeRequestsCount.longValue();
7510    this.region.mutateRow(rm);
7511    long wrcAfterMutate = this.region.writeRequestsCount.longValue();
7512    Assert.assertEquals(wrcBeforeMutate + rm.getMutations().size(), wrcAfterMutate);
7513  }

7536  /**
7537   * The same as HRegion class, the only difference is that instantiateHStore will create a
7538   * different HStore - HStoreForTesting. [HBASE-8518]
7539   */
7540  public static class HRegionForTesting extends HRegion {
7541
7542    public HRegionForTesting(final Path tableDir, final WAL wal, final FileSystem fs,
7543      final Configuration confParam, final RegionInfo regionInfo, final TableDescriptor htd,
7544      final RegionServerServices rsServices) {
7545      this(new HRegionFileSystem(confParam, fs, tableDir, regionInfo), wal, confParam, htd,
7546        rsServices);
7547    }
7548
7549    public HRegionForTesting(HRegionFileSystem fs, WAL wal, Configuration confParam,
7550      TableDescriptor htd, RegionServerServices rsServices) {
7551      super(fs, wal, confParam, htd, rsServices);
7552    }
7553
7554    /**
7555     * Create HStore instance.
7556     * @return If Mob is enabled, return HMobStore, otherwise return HStoreForTesting.
7557     */
7558    @Override
7559    protected HStore instantiateHStore(final ColumnFamilyDescriptor family, boolean warmup)
7560      throws IOException {
7561      if (family.isMobEnabled()) {
7562        if (HFile.getFormatVersion(this.conf) < HFile.MIN_FORMAT_VERSION_WITH_TAGS) {
7563          throw new IOException("A minimum HFile version of " + HFile.MIN_FORMAT_VERSION_WITH_TAGS
7564            + " is required for MOB feature. Consider setting " + HFile.FORMAT_VERSION_KEY
7565            + " accordingly.");
7566        }
7567        return new HMobStore(this, family, this.conf, warmup);
7568      }
7569      return new HStoreForTesting(this, family, this.conf, warmup);
7570    }
7571  }
7572
7573  /**
7574   * HStoreForTesting is merely the same as HStore, the difference is in the doCompaction method of
7575   * HStoreForTesting there is a checkpoint "hbase.hstore.compaction.complete" which doesn't let
7576   * hstore compaction complete. In the former edition, this config is set in HStore class inside
7577   * compact method, though this is just for testing, otherwise it doesn't do any help. In
7578   * HBASE-8518, we try to get rid of all "hbase.hstore.compaction.complete" config (except for
7579   * testing code).
7580   */
7581  public static class HStoreForTesting extends HStore {
7582
7583    protected HStoreForTesting(final HRegion region, final ColumnFamilyDescriptor family,
7584      final Configuration confParam, boolean warmup) throws IOException {
7585      super(region, family, confParam, warmup);
7586    }
7587
7588    @Override
7589    protected List<HStoreFile> doCompaction(CompactionRequestImpl cr,
7590      Collection<HStoreFile> filesToCompact, User user, long compactionStartTime,
7591      List<Path> newFiles) throws IOException {
7592      // let compaction incomplete.
7593      if (!this.conf.getBoolean("hbase.hstore.compaction.complete", true)) {
7594        LOG.warn("hbase.hstore.compaction.complete is set to false");
7595        List<HStoreFile> sfs = new ArrayList<>(newFiles.size());
7596        final boolean evictOnClose =
7597          getCacheConfig() != null ? getCacheConfig().shouldEvictOnClose() : true;
7598        for (Path newFile : newFiles) {
7599          // Create storefile around what we wrote with a reader on it.
7600          HStoreFile sf = storeEngine.createStoreFileAndReader(newFile);
7601          sf.closeStoreFile(evictOnClose);
7602          sfs.add(sf);
7603        }
7604        return sfs;
7605      }
7606      return super.doCompaction(cr, filesToCompact, user, compactionStartTime, newFiles);
7607    }
7608  }
